ThreeWay_ArabellaJergal.synopsis: Arabella and Withers interact in camp. You can tell Arabella her parents are dead, leading to Withers calming her down. You learn her power and she will get sent off to Sorcerous SUndires after the end of Act 2
ThreeWay_ArabellaJergal.how_to_trigger: addTag ACT2_SHADOW_CURSE_IMMUNE:b47643e0-583c-4808-b108-f6d3b605b0a9 (ReCon command)oe CAMP_JergalToCampgoto -149; 16talk to Arabella and send her to campgoto -182; 17speak to corpse tender and discover corpse is Arballe'a parentclick on both the corpsesGo to camp and click on Arabella or Jergal.

Arabella.synopsis: Default Arabella dialogue. Much of it is fallback if Withers is unavailable for some reason.

PAD_ArabellaLeftLetter.synopsis: PAD that plays after the player read Arabella's letter in Act 3 Camp, telling them she has gone off to find her own way. Players will get different lines depending on if they resolved her Act 2 quest line fully by having her have a heart to heart with Jergal after losing her parents or not.Bad version text: [The ink is still fresh, and the letter is drawn in a careful hand.]So I guess I shouldn't be too mad. I mean, I'm not snake food thanks to you. But I still thought you'd be helping me out, finding my parents and stuff...Don't matter though really, does it?  The curse took them,  or maybe one of those cultist creeps. I got to accept that. Just like I got to accept I'm on my own now. But don't you go worrying, Bone Man said the weave'll guide me. Don't know what that means, exactly, but I'll figure it out.- ArabellaGood version text:[The ink is still fresh, and the letter is drawn in a careful hand.]Hey you. So, I owe you a lot. For one, I don't know what the inside of a snake's belly looks like. For another, you let me stay at your camp. And for ANOTHER another, you found out what happened to moms and pops.I'm on my own now and Bone Man says it's a good thing. I just have to let the Weave guide me. And as far as I can tell, it's tugging me to Baldur's Gate, so I'm headed there first.Anyway, thanks for everything. I won't forget it.- Arabella

AD_ArabellaJergal.synopsis: Arabella and Withers do an AD in camp.
AD_ArabellaJergal.how_to_trigger: Save Arabella in TWN, send her to camp. FInd her dead parents and inform her.

ThreeWay_ArabellaJergal_33.speaker: Arabella
ThreeWay_ArabellaJergal_33.text: Hey - you never said you were friends with a skellie!

ThreeWay_ArabellaJergal_1.speaker: Withers
ThreeWay_ArabellaJergal_1.text: I am not a 'skellie'. Thou shalt call me Withers.

ThreeWay_ArabellaJergal_25.speaker: Arabella
ThreeWay_ArabellaJergal_25.text: 'Withers'? I'm not going to remember that! I'm calling you 'Bone Man'.

ThreeWay_ArabellaJergal_19.speaker: Player
ThreeWay_ArabellaJergal_19.text: I'm glad to see you're getting along.

ThreeWay_ArabellaJergal_56.speaker: Arabella
ThreeWay_ArabellaJergal_56.text: He's funny - like my grandpa when he didn't get his nap.
ThreeWay_ArabellaJergal_56.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to player. She's mocking Withers here.

ThreeWay_ArabellaJergal_32.speaker: Arabella
ThreeWay_ArabellaJergal_32.text: Hey Bone Man, can you make your teeth chatter?

ThreeWay_ArabellaJergal_40.speaker: Withers
ThreeWay_ArabellaJergal_40.text: I can, but I will not.

ThreeWay_ArabellaJergal_70.speaker: Player
ThreeWay_ArabellaJergal_70.text: Bad news, Arabella. Your parents are dead.

ThreeWay_ArabellaJergal_64.speaker: Withers
ThreeWay_ArabellaJergal_64.text: Soon enough. But first, thou must tend to the girl. It is time she learns the truth.

ThreeWay_ArabellaJergal_14.speaker: Withers
ThreeWay_ArabellaJergal_14.text: Thou shan't leave. The girl must know the truth.

ThreeWay_ArabellaJergal_22.speaker: Arabella
ThreeWay_ArabellaJergal_22.text: The truth? Wait. What do you mean?

ThreeWay_ArabellaJergal_36.speaker: Withers
ThreeWay_ArabellaJergal_36.text: Speak, and let it be done.

ThreeWay_ArabellaJergal_39.speaker: Narrator
ThreeWay_ArabellaJergal_39.text: *A single image haunts your mind - a tiefling corpse, carelessly mauled in the so-called House of Healing.*
ThreeWay_ArabellaJergal_39.context: InternalNodeContext: Needs to remain so the player is sure to connect  the corpse with this moment.

ThreeWay_ArabellaJergal_59.speaker: Player
ThreeWay_ArabellaJergal_59.text: Tell her yourself, if it means that much.

ThreeWay_ArabellaJergal_18.speaker: Withers
ThreeWay_ArabellaJergal_18.text: Thou mayest deny truth. I do not.

ThreeWay_ArabellaJergal_4.speaker: Withers
ThreeWay_ArabellaJergal_4.text: Thy parents have left for the Fugue Plane. They are, in a word, dead.

ThreeWay_ArabellaJergal_15.speaker: Arabella
ThreeWay_ArabellaJergal_15.context: CinematicNodeContext:  Arabella in disbelief shoots glances between the player and Withers expectantlyNodeContext: In disbelief and anger, hearing her parents  have died.

ThreeWay_ArabellaJergal_11.speaker: Arabella
ThreeWay_ArabellaJergal_11.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Black flames surround Arabella as her anger grows. (Visualisation can be changed if needed, see Kevin V.)

Arabella's anger grows as black flames surround her, a magical manifestation of her hurt and rage.NodeContext: Arabella's anger grows and black flames surround her as she yells, a magical manifestation of her hurt and rage.

ThreeWay_ArabellaJergal_12.context: CinematicNodeContext: The flames surrounding Arabella intensify.

ThreeWay_ArabellaJergal_26.speaker: Withers
ThreeWay_ArabellaJergal_26.text: Listen. Dost thou not hear it? Where creation meets ruin, where morning meets midnight - the root of all being.
ThreeWay_ArabellaJergal_26.context: CinematicNodeContext: Calmly, even as Arabella's magic rages. Addressed to Arabella.NodeContext: Calmly, even as Arabella's magic rages. Addressed to Arabella.

ThreeWay_ArabellaJergal_21.speaker: Withers
ThreeWay_ArabellaJergal_21.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to Arabella.NodeContext: Addressed to Arabella.

ThreeWay_ArabellaJergal_73.speaker: Arabella
ThreeWay_ArabellaJergal_73.context: NodeContext: Still disturbed by learning of her parents, but calming

ThreeWay_ArabellaJergal_43.context: CinematicNodeContext: Arabella breathes and begins to calm.

ThreeWay_ArabellaJergal_27.speaker: Arabella
ThreeWay_ArabellaJergal_27.context: CinematicNodeContext: Calm now. Addressed to Withers, though more or less said to herself.NodeContext: Calm now. Addressed to Withers, though more or less said to hersel.

ThreeWay_ArabellaJergal_38.context: CinematicNodeContext: The black flames fade from Arabella and envelop the player.

ThreeWay_ArabellaJergal_58.speaker: Narrator
ThreeWay_ArabellaJergal_58.text: *Your very soul is tangled in shadow. Arabella's magic, wild as cursed briar. Her talent is now yours, too.*
ThreeWay_ArabellaJergal_58.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player is now surrounded by black flames

ThreeWay_ArabellaJergal_7.speaker: Withers
ThreeWay_ArabellaJergal_7.text: The girl must learn the ways of the arcane - but she shan't remain here.

ThreeWay_ArabellaJergal_61.speaker: Player
ThreeWay_ArabellaJergal_61.text: Who could teach the girl? Her magic is even wilder than mine.

ThreeWay_ArabellaJergal_24.speaker: Withers
ThreeWay_ArabellaJergal_24.text: She will tame it in time. The Weave would not see one like her abandoned.

ThreeWay_ArabellaJergal_20.speaker: Withers
ThreeWay_ArabellaJergal_20.text: The Weave knows her purpose. It will guide her plainly, if she listens.

ThreeWay_ArabellaJergal_17.speaker: Withers
ThreeWay_ArabellaJergal_17.text: Arabella holds a power beyond reckoning. That of the decaying forest, and the seedling that bore it.

ThreeWay_ArabellaJergal_3.speaker: Withers
ThreeWay_ArabellaJergal_3.text: But it is unbalanced. Her yoke is already heavy; if she walks thy path, it will surely break.

ThreeWay_ArabellaJergal_2.speaker: Withers
ThreeWay_ArabellaJergal_2.text: Arabella will depart, once thou dost leave these accursed lands. She will find her way safely; thus it is fated.

ThreeWay_ArabellaJergal_13.speaker: Arabella
ThreeWay_ArabellaJergal_13.text: Bone Man, you're making me leave?

ThreeWay_ArabellaJergal_54.speaker: Withers
ThreeWay_ArabellaJergal_54.text: Fear not, girl. The Weave knows thy purpose. It will guide thee, if thou dost listen.

ThreeWay_ArabellaJergal_41.speaker: Withers
ThreeWay_ArabellaJergal_41.text: Fear not, girl. Abandon not the Weave, and it shall not abandon thee.

ThreeWay_ArabellaJergal_8.speaker: Player
ThreeWay_ArabellaJergal_8.text: You can trust Withers. If he says you'll be safe, you should believe him.

ThreeWay_ArabellaJergal_66.speaker: Player
ThreeWay_ArabellaJergal_66.text: I'm sorry. I wish it could be different.

ThreeWay_ArabellaJergal_0.speaker: Player
ThreeWay_ArabellaJergal_0.text: I'm not going to make you go away.

ThreeWay_ArabellaJergal_44.speaker: Narrator
ThreeWay_ArabellaJergal_44.text: *You feel her grief fade as if it were your own - there is a lightness in her now, veiling the power within, soothing it.*
ThreeWay_ArabellaJergal_44.context: CinematicNodeContext: Withers does a magical motion with his hands. Arabella instantly becomes calm, focused. Withers continues to cast the magic - the black flame turns to white and becomes a warm glow that envelops Arabella and the player.

ThreeWay_ArabellaJergal_60.speaker: Arabella
ThreeWay_ArabellaJergal_60.text: Is that my future? Is that why they died?
ThreeWay_ArabellaJergal_60.context: CinematicNodeContext: Arabella peers at Withers' magic in wonder. NodeContext: Arabella peers at Withers' magic in wonder.

ThreeWay_ArabellaJergal_42.speaker: Arabella
ThreeWay_ArabellaJergal_42.text: Thank you, Bone Man. For being... nice.

ThreeWay_ArabellaJergal_10.speaker: Arabella
ThreeWay_ArabellaJergal_10.text: If there are people like you around, perhaps everything will be all right.
ThreeWay_ArabellaJergal_10.context: CinematicNodeContext: Warm glow fades. NodeContext: Warm glow fades. Arabella wipes a tear from her cheek as she looks at the player

ThreeWay_ArabellaJergal_49.speaker: Player
ThreeWay_ArabellaJergal_49.text: Why not? I'm not sending her out there alone.

ThreeWay_ArabellaJergal_48.speaker: Player
ThreeWay_ArabellaJergal_48.text: Fine with me. She's already outstayed her welcome.

ThreeWay_ArabellaJergal_72.speaker: Withers
ThreeWay_ArabellaJergal_72.text: I speak not with malice, but with prudence.

ThreeWay_ArabellaJergal_62.speaker: Player
ThreeWay_ArabellaJergal_62.text: I will teach her. I will help her channel the Weave.

ThreeWay_ArabellaJergal_53.speaker: Player
ThreeWay_ArabellaJergal_53.text: No. It isn't the right time.

ThreeWay_ArabellaJergal_28.speaker: Withers
ThreeWay_ArabellaJergal_28.text: She is ready. I have deemed it so.

ThreeWay_ArabellaJergal_35.speaker: Arabella
ThreeWay_ArabellaJergal_35.text: I don't believe it. They can't be...
ThreeWay_ArabellaJergal_35.context: CinematicNodeContext: Arabella is speaking with Withers. She is distraught about her parents' death and beginning to lose control.

ThreeWay_ArabellaJergal_29.speaker: Withers
ThreeWay_ArabellaJergal_29.text: Breathe, child. Resist not the winds of change. Let them carry thee.
ThreeWay_ArabellaJergal_29.context: CinematicNodeContext: Withers is speaking calmly to the child Arabella, to keep her from blowing up over finding out her parents are dead.

Arabella_24.speaker: Arabella
Arabella_24.text: Hey you - I made it, easy-peasy!

Arabella_42.speaker: Player
Arabella_42.text: Your parents are dead. I found their corpses.
Arabella_42.context: InternalNodeContext: Normal flow would be to break the news down in ArabellaJergal threeway dialog, keeping this node in for cases when Jergal is not available

Arabella_37.speaker: Arabella
Arabella_37.context: NodeContext: In disbleief about her parents being dead.

Arabella_0.speaker: Arabella
Arabella_0.context: NodeContext: Refusing to believe news that parents are dead

Arabella_3.speaker: Arabella
Arabella_3.context: NodeContext: Refusing to believe news that parents are dead

Arabella_28.speaker: Player
Arabella_28.text: You don't have to believe me for it to be true.

Arabella_12.speaker: Player
Arabella_12.text: It was quite the sight. Their corpses were all but turned inside out.

Arabella_36.speaker: Arabella
Arabella_36.text: Oh gods - no no no. You're lying. I know it.
Arabella_36.context: NodeContext: Refusing to believe news that parents are dead

Arabella_14.speaker: Player
Arabella_14.text: I wish this were simply another tale, but it's not. I'm telling you the truth.

Arabella_18.speaker: Arabella
Arabella_18.text: They'd never leave me. They promised.

Arabella_2.speaker: Player
Arabella_2.text: I know this is hard - but accepting their passing is the first step to healing.

Arabella_16.speaker: Player
Arabella_16.text: Death is simply another part of life, Arabella. It is not something to fear.

Arabella_52.speaker: Player
Arabella_52.text: Pain and loss only make you stronger, child. Embrace it.

Arabella_15.speaker: Player
Arabella_15.text: I haven't found your parents just yet.

Arabella_33.speaker: Arabella
Arabella_33.text: Well hurry. They gotta be somewhere. And I don't want 'em worrying.

Arabella_41.speaker: Arabella
Arabella_41.text: Then I'll teach you to conjure those vines.

Arabella_9.speaker: Player
Arabella_9.text: Teach me your vine trick. Maybe then I'll start looking.

Arabella_30.speaker: Arabella
Arabella_30.text: You find mum and pops, I'll show you the spell. And that's that.

Arabella_32.speaker: Arabella
Arabella_32.text: Nah - Mol taught me about deals. So I know a bad one when I hear it.

Arabella_11.speaker: Player
Arabella_11.text: They've... passed on, Arabella. Returned to the cycle. I'm sorry.

Arabella_53.speaker: Player
Arabella_53.text: They're with the gods now, Arabella. I'm sorry.

Arabella_8.speaker: Player
Arabella_8.text: For once, I find myself at a loss for words. They're gone, Arabella - I'm sorry.

Arabella_19.speaker: Player
Arabella_19.text: They're with Kelemvor now, my child. But he will care for them as they did you.

Arabella_27.speaker: Player
Arabella_27.text: Oh, they're very dead. But don't worry - being an orphan makes you much more interesting.

Arabella_44.speaker: Arabella
Arabella_44.text: I guess I can take care of myself. I mean, I've gotten this far.

Arabella_49.speaker: Arabella
Arabella_49.text: If Bone Man says I'll be all right, I'll be all right.

Arabella_26.speaker: Arabella
Arabella_26.text: I just wish - I wish it was different. I wish mum and pops was here.

Arabella_5.speaker: Player
Arabella_5.text: It hurts, I know it does. But you'll feel better in time.

Arabella_54.speaker: Player
Arabella_54.text: You've been so strong. They'd be so proud of you.

Arabella_51.speaker: Arabella
Arabella_51.text: I don't feel so strong. Or anything, really. Just tired.

Arabella_22.speaker: Player
Arabella_22.text: Well, they're not, so you can quit your snivelling.

Arabella_13.speaker: Arabella
Arabella_13.text: You don't have to be mean. I was just saying.

PAD_ArabellaLeftLetter_0.speaker: Player
PAD_ArabellaLeftLetter_0.text: Arabella's gone to the city, then. We may yet see her again.

PAD_ArabellaLeftLetter_1.speaker: Player
PAD_ArabellaLeftLetter_1.text: Arabella's gone, then. Even with those talents of hers, there's no guarantee she'll survive...

AD_ArabellaJergal_0.speaker: Arabella
AD_ArabellaJergal_0.text: I never met a skeleton before. Are you, you know - dead?

AD_ArabellaJergal_9.speaker: Withers
AD_ArabellaJergal_9.text: I am not a skeleton. I am neither dead, nor undead. Neither alive, nor unliving.

AD_ArabellaJergal_3.speaker: Arabella
AD_ArabellaJergal_3.text: So what were you before you were... this?

AD_ArabellaJergal_4.speaker: Arabella
AD_ArabellaJergal_4.text: So you've always been a bone man?
